ap.name: AP
ap.text: Immigration hard-liner Kris Kobach is pursuing a political comeback in Kansas. The former Kansas secretary of state is running for state attorney general after losing a general election for governor in 2018 and a GOP primary for the U.S. Senate in 2020.

ap.name: AP
ap.text:
More than halfway through a tumultuous primary season, with several ousters and upsets. Primary season resumes in August, with many high-profile races still coming.
Here's a look at what's happened so far and what's next.

ap.name: AP
ap.text: President Joe Biden will award the United States' highest civilian honor, the Presidential Medal of Freedom, to gymnast Simone Biles, actor Denzel Washington, the late Sen. John McCain and 14 others at the White House next week.

ap.name: AP
ap.text: The Supreme Court’s decision limiting the reach of the Clean Air Act could resonate beyond the Environmental Protection Agency and its authority to regulate climate change, impacting education, food, transportation and other areas of everyday life.

ap.name: AP
ap.text: Stunning new revelations about Donald Trump’s fight to overturn the 2020 election have exposed growing political vulnerabilities just as he eyes another presidential bid. Republican voters — and Trump's would-be rivals in a 2024 race — are taking notice.

ap.name: AP
ap.text: President Joe Biden has wound up a five-day trip to Europe that highlighted both the key U.S. role in mounting a strong allied response to Vladimir Putin’s aggression and the domestic turmoil that is dragging Biden down at home.

ap.name: AP
ap.text: Senate Republican leader Mitch McConnell is threatening to derail a bill designed to boost semiconductor manufacturing in the United States if Democrats revive their stalled package of energy and economic initiatives.

ap.name: AP
ap.text: BREAKING: Thomas Lynch wins Republican nomination for U.S. House in Illinois' 2nd Congressional District. #APRaceCall at 6:56 p.m. CDT.

ap.name: AP
ap.text: BREAKING: Eric Carlson wins Republican nomination for U.S. House in Illinois' 1st Congressional District. #APRaceCall at 6:00 p.m. CDT.

ap.name: AP
ap.text: BREAKING: Regan Deering wins Republican nomination for U.S. House in Illinois' 13th Congressional District. #APRaceCall at 6:00 p.m. CDT.

ap.name: AP
ap.text: President Biden called a Supreme Court ruling that limited the EPA in curbing power plant emissions “another devastating decision." Biden said the ruling aims to move the U.S. backward in the climate fight.

ap.name: AP
ap.text: President Biden says the Supreme Court’s decision ending a constitutional right to abortion is “destabilizing” and he supports changing Senate filibuster rules to codify nationwide abortion protections.

ap.name: AP
ap.text: After 30 years on the Supreme Court, Justice Clarence Thomas’ influence has never been greater. Yet he remains a lightning rod for controversy — including questions about his wife’s role in trying to overturn the result of the 2020 presidential election.

ap.name: AP
ap.text: Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg launches a $1 billion pilot program aimed at helping to reconnect cities and neighborhoods racially segregated or divided by road projects. The Reconnecting Communities program promises aid to dozens of communities.

ap.name: AP
ap.text: Sen. Patrick Leahy of Vermont has broken a hip in a fall at his home and was to undergo surgery to repair it, his office said. The 82-year-old Democrat fell Wednesday night in McLean, Virginia.

ap.name: AP
ap.text: The United States’ first Native American treasurer wants to honor her heritage in her new role at the Treasury Department. She says she hopes to sign the currency as “either Chief Lynn Malerba or Chief Many Hearts Lynn Malerba.”

ap.name: AP
ap.text: President Biden’s energy point man says he knows moving from climate-wrecking fossil fuel is the only way to go. But when it comes to Europe's crisis, Amos Hochstein can sound like the West’s oilfield roustabout, taking a wrench to global supply shortfall.

ap.name: AP
ap.text: AP-NORC poll: About half of Americans believe former President Donald Trump should be charged for a crime for his role in the Jan. 6 U.S. Capitol attack.

ap.name: AP
ap.text: The country’s first Native American Treasurer wants to honor her heritage in her new role: “I hope to sign the US currency either Chief Lynn Malerba or Chief Many Hearts Lynn Malerba.”

ap.name: AP
ap.text: BREAKING: Adam Frisch wins Democratic nomination for U.S. House in Colorado's 3rd Congressional District. #APRaceCall at 10:30 a.m. MDT.

afp.name: AFP
afp.text: 🇹🇭 Thai social media users share misleading 'natural cure for gallstones'

afp.name: AFP
afp.text:
🇵🇰 As Pakistan grappled with a power crisis, Facebook users shared the false claim that a local TV channel had reported a decrease in petrol prices

The channel actually reported that demand for petrol – not petrol prices -- had dropped

afp.name: AFP
afp.text:
More parents are questioning the necessity of routine vaccinations for young children. Adults are skipping shots as well, even for vaccines with a long safety record.
The trend comes amid a wave of misinformation about #COVID19 and the vaccines.

afp.name: AFP
afp.text: 🇱🇰 Sri Lanka posts share misleading claim about 'water-powered cars' as fuel reserves shrink

afp.name: AFP
afp.text:
Photo shows trash left behind after Greta Thunberg's speech at Glastonbury in 2022? 

⚠️ It was taken in 2015, the photographer told AFP

afp.name: AFP
afp.text:
AFP launches an online training platform open to all journalists and journalism students

➡️   
￼ 
1/2

afp.name: AFP
afp.text:
Big fossil fuel companies are too smart to get caught pushing outright untruths, researchers say. 

Instead they make statements that are unsubstantiated, unaudited or unverifiable. We examine the trend:

afp.name: AFP
afp.text:
🌿 A list of herbs said to induce miscarriages circulated online after the reversal of Roe v. Wade in the US.

While some of the substances have been linked to pregnancy loss, experts say they can be ineffective and dangerous

afp.name: AFP
afp.text:
🌍 Climate change is increasing the intensity and severity of wildfires.

Scientists say these measures are key to understanding the impact of global warming on fires, not the amount of land burned

afp.name: AFP
afp.text:
🇬🇧 Photo of UK Prime Minister @BorisJohnson inspecting his broken shoe? ❌

This photo shows Johnson removing his shoes before entering Mahatma Gandhi's ashram in India.

afp.name: AFP
afp.text:
Misinformation is circulating about a massive earthquake that killed more than 1,000 people last week in Afghanistan 

A series of photos purportedly showing the aftermath of the disaster were actually taken years ago in Pakistan and Italy

afp.name: AFP
afp.text:
⚠️ Footage of a blaze on a platform in the sea has been viewed more than 40,000 times in posts claiming it shows a Ukrainian strike on an oil rig in the Black Sea last month 🔥

That's not true ❌ We found pictures of the fire circulating online since 2004

afp.name: AFP
afp.text:
⚠️ A video of people prostrating has been shared in posts that claim it shows people mourning after a deadly earthquake in Afghanistan in June 2022

But the video has circulated in reports from 2021 about the Taliban celebrating the US withdrawal

afp.name: AFP
afp.text:
🇱🇷 Photo of fire at Islamic boarding school in Liberia that killed more than 100 people? ❌

This photo shows fire at a government office at Indonesia's West Kalimantan province in 2016. 🇮🇩

There were no reported casualties in the Indonesian incident.

afp.name: AFP
afp.text:
🇺🇸 This amendment to an anti-abortion bill in Kentucky circulated online following the US Supreme Court's reversal of Roe v. Wade.

But the amendment is from 2019 -- it did not pass. A Democratic lawmaker introduced it as a protest

afp.name: AFP
afp.text:
🇺🇸 Does Missouri prohibit pregnant people from getting divorced?

It is not illegal, but experts say judges do typically wait to finalize a proceeding until after the birth to resolve custody

afp.name: AFP
afp.text:
✈️ New visa rules for Kenyans travelling to other countries through the European Union?

❌ There is no new rule - travelers only need Schengen visas if they exit airports

afp.name: AFP
afp.text:
📢 #AFP is looking for a #Dutch #Digital Verification #Journalist
📍 Location: The Hague, Europe 
📆 Starting date: ASAP
⏰ Deadline for applications: July 15, 2022
💻 
#JoinUs #Jobs #Careers #journalismjobs #factchecking #journalism

afp.name: AFP
afp.text: 🇧🇩 Footage shows BJP activists scuffling with police, not vandals attacking Nupur Sharma's house

bbc.name: BBC
bbc.text: Definite feel since this that mood is turning. Ministers saying they feel “dispensable”, government insiders saying the mood in cabinet is “changing” and morale low. One government source says two schools of thought in Downing St - “batten down hatches” or “be as open as we can.”

bbc.name: BBC
bbc.text:
"How would you feel if your child, or one you knew, was taken into care and ended up living in a B&B, a hostel, or even slept rough?"

Actor Michael Sheen meets young people in care as part of BBC investigation into how the system works

bbc.name: BBC
bbc.text: UK economic outlook has deteriorated, Bank of England warns

bbc.name: BBC
bbc.text:
“I don’t think anyone goes into politics to go out and defend blind like that. But that is what I'm afraid is now expected of government ministers"

Former minister David Gauke tells #R4Wato he hopes "at some point or other, they say enough is enough”

bbc.name: BBC
bbc.text:
"We're demanding that the UK government stop licensing and consent for the 40 new oil and gas projects... we need to be outraged at that"

Emma Brown from Just Stop Oil tells #PoliticsLive why activists targeted the Hay Wain in the National Gallery

bbc.name: BBC
bbc.text: Last week PM Boris Johnson "did not immediately recall" conversation in 2019 about Chris Pincher incident, but "as soon as he was reminded the No 10 press office corrected their public lines," claims minister Michael Ellis

bbc.name: BBC
bbc.text:
“I have no reason to doubt the Prime Minister”

Defence secretary Ben Wallace says he “hasn’t looked” at Lord McDonald’s claims that the Prime Minister had been briefed on Chris Pincher’s behaviour before he was made deputy chief whip

#Newsnight

bbc.name: BBC
bbc.text:
The SNP's Brendan O'Hara calls Michael Ellis the minister for "defending the indefensible... sent out to defend his boss"

Ellis says "it's not indefensible to defend natural justice"

bbc.name: BBC
bbc.text: The Prime Minister's Official Spokesman has confirmed that Boris Johnson WAS briefed about the outcome about a complaint relating to Chris Pincher after an investigation had concluded in 2019, reports @BBCHelenCatt

bbc.name: BBC
bbc.text:
Conservative MP William Wragg asks ministers "if they can any longer tolerate being part of a government which... is widely regarded of having lost its sense of direction"

He says what ministers are asked to say in public "changes seemingly by the hour"

bbc.name: BBC
bbc.text:
"It gives the impression of an anarchic and chaotic No 10 in which people are appointed... because they are staunchly loyal to a prime minister who is perpetually in trouble and needs friends"

- The Telegraph's Tim Stanley
#PoliticsLive

bbc.name: BBC
bbc.text:
"It does appear that ministers of the crown have been lied to by people in Downing Street," says Conservative MP Mark Harper on Chris Pincher, "I think the prime minister has some serious questions to answer"

 #PoliticsLive

bbc.name: BBC
bbc.text:
"It is about time these powerful men realise they can't just do whatever they like. They have to be held to account"

Labour's Emily Thornberry says Chris Pincher case shows Boris Johnson is "prepared to lie" and "defend people whose behaviour is appaling"

bbc.name: BBC
bbc.text:
“I’m supporting the Prime Minister”

Attorney General Suella Braverman declines to answer whether she thinks Boris Johnson told the truth about what he knew of allegations to Chris Pincher

#Newsnight

bbc.name: BBC
bbc.text:
On today's #PoliticsLive

Mark Harper MP, Conservative
Kirsten Oswald MP, SNP
Anoosh Chakelian, New Statesman
Tim Stanley, The Telegraph

On @BBCTwo at 11:45 due to Wimbledon

bbc.name: BBC
bbc.text:
Why Labour's leader has made peace with Brexit 

@ChrisMasonBBC on the "one heck of an about-turn" from Sir Keir Starmer

bbc.name: BBC
bbc.text:
"I am conscious of the duty owed to the target of an investigation but I act out of my duty towards the victims. Mr Pincher deceived me and others in 2019"

Read ex-top civil servant Lord McDonald's letter to the Parliamentary Commissioner for Standards

bbc.name: BBC
bbc.text:
Deputy Labour leader Angela Rayner granted urgent question in the Commons on the Chris Pincher row at around 12.30 BST

Follow live

bbc.name: BBC
bbc.text: Just Stop Oil protesters glue themselves to John Constable masterpiece

bbc.name: BBC
bbc.text:
Can people believe what No 10 is saying? 

@ChrisMasonBBC says Lord McDonald's intervention this morning was "quietly devastating"

Bravo to all who made it happen!👏More➡️

ebu.text:
Thanks to all the participants of the 88th #EBUGA for a stimulating and inspiring meeting in #Dubrovnik 👏

Thanks to our hosts HRT @hrtvijesti!

We look forward to joining @rtve in Madrid next summer!

#PublicServiceMedia

ebu.name: European Broadcasting Union (EBU)
ebu.text:
.@PubliekeOmroep’s Frederieke Leeflang tells the #EBUGA to 'embrace the unknown & you won’t be afraid to go forward'

Her tips for leadership
🟦Bring a positive mindset
🟦Imagine & seek the unknown
🟦Ask for help & support
🟦Get feedback

Members can watch

ebu.name: European Broadcasting Union (EBU)
European Broadcasting Union (EBU)
ebu.text: 150% committed to the members and the ongoing #transformation of Public Service Media: DG Noel Curran with a prolonged mandate. He stays at the helm of @EBU_HQ. 🥳 Great news during yesterday's kick-off of the General Assembly (finally taking place after a 2-year hiatus) #EBUGA

ebu.name: European Broadcasting Union (EBU)
ebu.text: It's been confirmed that our Director General Noel Curran will continue leading the EBU for the next 6 years👏👏👏

ebu.name: European Broadcasting Union (EBU)
ebu.text:
The second day of the #EBUGA in Dubrovnik is about to begin!

Don’t forget members can join us live online at 11 CEST for a special session on leading change with Martin Reeves from @BCG and Director Generals from across Europe

➡️ Just log in at

ebu.name: European Broadcasting Union (EBU)
ebu.text:
We’ve wrapped up the first day of the #EBUGA, with a special session looking at 100 years of #PublicServiceMedia

Our broadcasters are driven by the positive impact they can have on every single person they serve

Watch our new video 👇

#PSM100 #KeepMediaGood

ebu.name: European Broadcasting Union (EBU)
ebu.text: BBC and @svt Directors General Tim Davie and @HannaStjarne talk vision, leadership and what it takes for #PublicServiceMedia to stay relevant for the next 100yrs at the final session of today's #EBUGA

ebu.name: European Broadcasting Union (EBU)
ebu.text:
How do we attract more young people to the industry?

🟦Dare to be more inspiring in our content output
🟦Change the workforce culture
🟦Be ready to change every single day/be more flexible
🟦Put the audience first

Some pieces of advice shared by PSM future leaders at the #EBUGA

ebu.name: European Broadcasting Union (EBU)
ebu.text:
Asun Gómez Bueno, V-C of our News Committee,  discusses our new task force on journalism safety at the #EBUGA

"Public Journalism is a public good that we all must protect. The Task Force...has the objective to protect journalists worldwide and ultimately safeguard democracy."

ebu.name: European Broadcasting Union (EBU)
ebu.text:
"Never have we lived in a world with so much information and, at the same time, never have we lived in a world with so much disinformation & propaganda. But the responsibility of journalism has not changed"

@bbclysedoucet addresses the #EBUGA on the role of trusted media in war

ebu.name: European Broadcasting Union (EBU)
ebu.text:
Our DG Noel Curran highlights the power and importance of working together at the #EBUGA and thanks our Members for how they have responded to the war in #Ukraine 👇

#PublicServiceMedia

ebu.name: European Broadcasting Union (EBU)
ebu.text:
We’re committed to #PublicServiceMedia (PSM). We…  

1️⃣ Help deliver the stories that matter  
2️⃣ Enable our Members to build the PSM of tomorrow  
3️⃣ Use our voice to champion and influence  

Find out more in our Annual Report!  

#EBUGA

ebu.name: European Broadcasting Union (EBU)
ebu.text: At the opening of the 88th General Assembly of  @EBU_HQ in #Dubrovnik I expressed our commitment to preserve and develop European public service broadcasters as key pillars for our democratic societies

firstdraft.name: First Draft
firstdraft.text:
1/12 🚨 Organization news!

First Draft's mission is moving to @Brown_SPH as part of a new initiative being launched today - the Information Futures Lab (@IFL_Brown). See letter from @cward1e for details.

firstdraft.name: First Draft
firstdraft.text:
During this #auspol election, our research found that conspiracy theorists primarily attacked the legitimacy of the AEC to advance baseless claims of election fraud. Read more here: 

h/t @estherswchan @stevievzh @juliabergin1 @annekrugernews

firstdraft.name: First Draft
firstdraft.text:
'First Draft’s monitoring documented a treasure trove of conspiratorial content, scare campaigns, and misinformation relating to the electoral process.' 

Read more about what we found during the 2022 Australian federal election #auspol #ausvotes22:

firstdraft.name: First Draft
firstdraft.text: A @firstdraftnews manifesto (of sorts) following months of monitoring misinfo during the #AusVotes22 election. The team @estherswchan, @stevievzh and @annekrugernews noted narratives old and new, Aus-made and imported, trumpeted on trucks and in Telegram throughout the campaign.

firstdraft.name: First Draft
firstdraft.text: The #Disinformation Project's recent report  flagged degree to which information disorders, already entrenched, will expand to influence NZ's next electoral moments in unprecedented ways. Key lessons from across the Tasman vital to embrace. @Knhannah

firstdraft.name: First Draft
firstdraft.text:
Findings from months of #auspol monitoring and analysis in the article 👇 

Thrilled to be working with @annekrugernews @stevievzh @juliabergin1 on this

firstdraft.name: First Draft
firstdraft.text: @firstdraftnews @estherswchan @juliabergin1 @annekrugernews At @firstdraftnews we advocate for a preemptive approach to countering such narratives. Misinfo is too large for any single newsroom to tackle, so we brought together journos and community groups, alerting them to emerging narratives so that they can consider how to prebunk ASAP

firstdraft.name: First Draft
firstdraft.text: @firstdraftnews @estherswchan @juliabergin1 @annekrugernews Election misinfo has become a fixture across the world. Claims of "rigged" elections have been repeated not just in this and the US election, but also the Myanmar coup, this year's French and Filipino elections, and have already begun to emerge ahead of Brazil's later this year

firstdraft.name: First Draft
firstdraft.text: @firstdraftnews @estherswchan @juliabergin1 @annekrugernews We summarise the main themes of mis/disinfo throughout this period, which includes narratives of voter fraud from both local contexts & imported from overseas, conspiracy theories about the WHO, scare campaigns using online & offline channels, and disinfo through online ads.

hindu.name: The Hindu
hindu.text: PM #NarendraModi’s asserted that #BJP's reach to the marginalised and “non-elite” sections of #minoritycommunities, was not just for Pasmanda community, but also to see ways in which Christian communities in #Kerala and #Goa could be reached out to.

hindu.name: The Hindu
hindu.text: Comment | The revision of sections relating to social reformers, freedom fighters, and writers is not only hurting the sentiments of the people who revere these individuals but is also an attack on the constitutional values that we collectively prize.

hindu.name: The Hindu
hindu.text: Security forces in #Sudan descended on an anti-coup sit in to try and disperse protesters in the capital, #Khartoum, wounding at least 11 people, a medical group said.

hindu.name: The Hindu
hindu.text: The proposal for expansion of #BRICS received “principled support” at the 14th BRICS summit that was hosted by #China during June 23-24, said #Russia’s ambassador to India Denis Alipov.

hindu.name: The Hindu
hindu.text: Former #Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey appeared before the ED in Delhi for questioning in a money laundering case linked to the alleged #NSE co-location #scam. The agency recorded his statement under criminal sections of the PMLA, officials said.

hindu.name: The Hindu
hindu.text: Deadline for completion of high speed rail route between #Mumbai and Gujarat's #Ahmedabad, popularly called the #bullettrain project, can be fixed only after assessment of delay in land acquisition in #Maharashtra and COVID impact, railway officials said.

hindu.name: The Hindu
hindu.text: Tension ran high at Moreh, #Manipur’s border town, following the killing of two #Tamil youths at Myanmar’s #Tamu town. They had both travelled to Tamu, where they were reportedly stalked by two motorcycle-borne youths and shot dead from a close range.

hindu.name: The Hindu
hindu.text: Just in | In what could be yet another shock to #ShivSena, its #LokSabha MP Rahul Shewale appealed #UddhavThackeray to support NDA's presidential candidate #DraupadiMurmu, reports @alokdesh

hindu.name: The Hindu

hindu.text: Police are on the lookout for a cleric at the Ajmer Dargah after he allegedly offered on camera to gift his house to anyone who beheads the now-suspended #BJP spokesperson #NupurSharma for her remark on Prophet Muhammad

hindu.name: The Hindu
hindu.text: Benchmark BSE #Sensex on Tuesday gave up intra-day gains to close lower by a little over 100 points on emergence of fag-end selling in FMCG, banking and IT stocks and weak opening in European stock markets.

hindu.name: The Hindu
hindu.text: The #rupee fell by 41 paise to close at a fresh lifetime low of ₹79.36 against the U.S. dollar on Tuesday amid a strong greenback overseas and unrelenting foreign fund outflows.

reuters_institute.name: Reuters Institute for the Study of Journalism
reuters_institute.text:
You've got email! 

📬Our weekly newsletter is out, featuring @nicnewman @fedecherubini @miuemily @julieposetti @karolisvy @NiemanReports @RachelCDailey @MirrorAlison @jamlabafrica @kbontcheva @svaradarajan @zoo_bear @camposmello and others

reuters_institute.name: Reuters Institute for the Study of Journalism
reuters_institute.text: On the day we begin our semester at the Oxford Climate Journalism Network @risj_oxford, an important reminder by alpinist @ferranlatorre on how climate change is affecting mountains and glaciers, sometimes with tragic consequences -as just seen in the Alps.

reuters_institute.name: Reuters Institute for the Study of Journalism
reuters_institute.text: Today we are so thrilled to welcome the second cohort of the Oxford Climate Journalism Network. All the members of the network, founded by @MeeraSelva1 @wblau and run by @arguedasortiz and @katherine_dunn, are in this Twitter list. Follow it below

reuters_institute.name: Reuters Institute for the Study of Journalism
reuters_institute.text:
Il @risj_oxford fa un quadro dell’informazione sul #cambiamentoclimatico a livello globale, dal diffuso disinteresse ai nuovi canali di comunicazione

#climatechange #crisiclilamtica #informazione #greeninfluencer #ReutersInstitute #DigitalNewsReport

reuters_institute.name: Reuters Institute for the Study of Journalism
reuters_institute.text: This week's Webinar with @kirstenaeddy, postdoc at @risj_oxford, takes a deep dive into reader behaviour and what the data community needs to know about these global trends.

reuters_institute.name: Reuters Institute for the Study of Journalism
reuters_institute.text:
You've got mail? We look at the role of email in news consumption patterns in one of the chapters from #DNR22 
 
📚 Read the chapter, authored by @nicnewman

🎙 Listen to the pod with @fedecherubini

🧵Key findings in thread

reuters_institute.text:

wapo.text:
“Wordle” fan? The National Gallery of Art has launched a copycat.

The new game, “Artle,” offers art fans a chance to test how well they can identify any of the 150,000 pieces housed by the gallery.

wapo.name: The Washington Post
wapo.text: Scenes of chaos unfolded at Fourth of July celebrations in several cities nationwide, as the booming sounds of fireworks were apparently mistaken for gunshots, sending scores of revelers fleeing for cover.

Police arrested “a person of interest” in a hunt for the Highland Park gunman who killed six people and injured dozens at a Fourth of July parade on Monday, shaking the Chicago suburb.

wapo.text: The Ott case, in which an agent in the Austrian domestic security service is suspected of having sold state secrets to Russia, is fueling questions about the extent to which Moscow’s influence came to permeate this European nation.

wapo.text: WNBA star Brittney Griner, who has been detained in Russia since February on drug charges, wrote a letter to President Biden that was delivered to the White House on Monday morning, her sports agency said.

Tuesday briefing: 

- A mass shooting at a July Fourth parade left at least six people dead.
- Protests erupted in Ohio after police released video of a Black man’s killing.
- A WNBA star detained in Russia asked President Biden for help.

wapo.name: The Washington Post
wapo.text: The al-Hol camp in Syria remains one of the most intractable problems for the region — effectively an open-air prison holding tens of thousands of mostly women and children from around the world, many with family ties to ISIS.

wapo.name: The Washington Post
wapo.text: The man detained by police as a “person of interest” in the shooting in a Chicago suburb that left six people dead and many more injured Monday was a local rapper whose online presence contained tinges of violence.

wapo.name: The Washington Post
wapo.text: In an instant, the day’s festivities were transformed by a tragedy all too common in the nation they were celebrating. A mass shooting left six dead, 40 wounded and another American city shattered.

wapo.name: The Washington Post
wapo.text: A gunman on a rooftop fired dozens of rounds at spectators at a Fourth of July parade in a Chicago suburb on Monday, killing at least six people and injuring more than 30.
